timeline.author: nictas

timeline.bodyText: You're relying on the equals method of X509Certificate. Does it do the same thing as the previous check?
timeline.author: nictas

replies.bodyText:
Yes, it was the same check previously, although in a much more ineffective way
targetCertificates.stream().anyMatch(cert -> Object.equals(cert, givenCert))
replies.author: radito3

timeline.bodyText: Why were we using this in the first place?? /facepalm
timeline.author: nictas

timeline.bodyText: The name of the method does not make much sense after removing the int numberOfDays argument. Put it back.
timeline.author: nictas

timeline.bodyText: applicationGuid is more consistent with the name of the method. Additionally, this really is a GUID, even though the name of the VCAP_APPLICATION field does not reflect that.
timeline.author: nictas

replies.bodyText: This change was due to a sonar code smell because there is an instance variable named applicationGuid and this was the same, although with a smaller scope
replies.author: radito3

timeline.bodyText: The name of the method does not make much sense after removing the String path argument. Put it back.
timeline.author: nictas

timeline.message: Small refactoring in UploadAppStep and its test
Refactor ThreadInfo classes to reduce redundancy
